title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Jerry Jones not swayed by Parsons' trade request
content: Cowboys owner and general manager Jerry Jones said Saturday he will not consider trading Micah Parsons after the star pass rusher posted on social media that he wants to leave the team.

title: WNBA: Fan arrested for throwing sex toy on court
content: The fan who threw a sex toy on the court during a Valkyries-Dream game this week was arrested, the WNBA said, adding that throwing objects on the court will earn an ejection and ban moving forward.

title: Braves-Reds showcase at Bristol stalled by rain
content: Major League Baseball's long-planned event at Bristol Motor Speedway met an unwelcome detour, when rain suspended the Braves-Reds game until Sunday.

title: Lillard returning to Weber State, this time as GM
content: Damian Lillard is returning to college, this time as general manager of Weber State, where he once starred.

title: Tempers flare in Boston after Neris' intentional balk
content: Astros reliever Hector Neris intentionally balked a runner to third, then argued with Boston's third base coach before both benches cleared in Houston's 7-3 loss on Saturday.

title: Messi exits Inter Miami's win with hammy injury
content: Lionel Messi suffered an hamstring injury during Inter Miami's Leagues Cup penalty shootout win over Club Necaxa.

title: Source: C's minority owner buying Sun for $325M
content: A group led by Celtics minority owner Steve Pagliuca has a deal in place to buy the WNBA's Connecticut Sun for a record $325 million and plans to move the team to Boston, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Pro Football HOF welcomes Sharpe, three others
content: Sterling Sharpe, Eric Allen, Jared Allen and Antonio Gates were all inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame on Saturday in Canton, Ohio.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: Sights and sounds from Bristol, Tennessee, at the MLB Speedway Classic
content: A record-breaking crowd was on hand Saturday to watch the Reds and Braves square off at Bristol Motor Speedway.

content: Did the CBA ruin NBA free agency? Bobby Marks plays "fact or fiction" with some of the offseason's most impactful trends.

content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

content: A number of Manchester United's squad are facing a crucial season as they look to prove they can be part of the club's future.

content: Arsenal's preseason tour featured the arrival of a new star striker and the emergence of a bright prospect.

content: Manchester United are pushing to sign Ferm√≠n L√≥pez from Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Young closes in on first title, up 5 at Wyndham
content: Cameron Young ran off four straight birdies on the front nine and stretched his lead to eight shots Saturday before he settled into a series of pars for a 5-under 65, giving him a 5-shot lead in the Wyndham Championship.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: ‚öæ MLB trade grades: Report cards for biggest deals
content: How did you team fare as a flurry of deals came down to the wire? Here's our scorecard for all the big moves.

title: üò° Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: üèà Source: Teammate offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Barnwell's NFL trade tiers for all 32 teams
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: üèà Deion says he's cancer-free after surgery
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: üèÄ Grading every NBA team's offseason
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: The Terry McLaurin trade request, explained: Why it could linger, and which teams should be interested
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands post-trade deadline
content: There was a lot of action across baseball ahead of Thursday's trade deadline. How did the moves impact each club's standing?

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: Risers and fallers: Fiebich trending up, Griner struggling
content: Leonie Fiebich has made the most of her increased opportunity on the Liberty, while Brittney Griner continues to have a down season.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Explosions Reported, Smoke Seen At Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant
content: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said on Saturday that its team at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) heard explosions and saw smoke coming from a nearby location.

title: Russia Earthquake May Have Caused Volcano Eruption After 600 Years
content: The overnight eruption of the Krasheninnikov Volcano in Kamchatka, its first in 600 years, may be connected to the huge earthquake that rocked Russia's Far East last week, Russia's RIA state news agency and scientists reported on Sunday.

title: From Sex Tape Scandal To Conviction: Timeline Of Case Against Prajwal Revanna
content: The case pertains to the rape of a 48-year-old woman who worked as domestic help at the family's Gannikada farmhouse in Hassan.

title: Mumbai Woman's Morphed Nude Photos Sent To Family Despite Loan Repayment
content: A 25-year-old woman in Mumbai was allegedly harassed by a loan app firm and her morphed nude photographs were shared with her relatives and friends, even as she handed over an amount of money that was more than what she borrowed.

title: Tremors Felt In New York As 3-Magnitude Earthquake Hits New Jersey
content: A small earthquake rattled the New York metropolitan area Saturday night. The US Geological Survey said the tremor had a magnitude of 3.0.

title: Twist In Puri Burn Case After Teen Dies, Father Releases Emotional Video
content: Hours after a teenager from Odisha died of severe burn injuries at AIIMS Delhi, new developments have added a twist to the Puri Balanga minor burn case.

title: Rahul Gandhi Claims Arun Jaitley Threatened Him. His Son Replies
content: Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi drew a sharp counter from late BJP leader Arun Jaitley's son this morning, over his claim that the government had sent him to threaten him against pursuing the farm law protests.

title: "How Much Can One Lie?" Ministers Shred Rahul Gandhi's Arun Jaitley Claim
content: Top ministers in the Narendra Modi government have slammed the Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, over his remarks on the late Arun Jaitley, a veteran BJP leader and former Union Minister

title: Shashi Tharoor Was Asked Who Would Be Next Vice President. His Response
content: The election for the next Vice President will be held on September 9, and the notification will be issued on August 7, the Election Commission said.

title: Slapped On Flight, He Went Missing, Then Found At Railway Station
content: The man who was slapped by a fellow passenger after suffering a panic attack mid-flight and then went missing has been found at a railway station in Assam's Barpeta, nearly 800 km from Kolkata, where the flight had landed.

title: Out On Bail In Rape Case, Man Follows Survivor, Shoots Her In Delhi
content: The woman, a head manager at a salon, was hit on the chest and was rushed to the AIIMS Trauma Centre in a PCR van.

title: Viral Video Found On Andhra Liquor Scam Accused Shows Rs 35 Crore Cash
content: A political row erupted in Andhra Pradesh on Saturday after a video that was allegedly found on an accused in the liquor scam case and showing a man counting cash, believed to be worth Rs 35 crore, surfaced online.

title: Woman, Boyfriend Kill Husband, Dump Body In Drain, How Cops Traced Them
content: The murder was committed over the affair, as well as the victim's abusive and criminal behaviour, the police said.

title: Streets Waterlogged After Heavy Rain In Delhi, 'Yellow' Alert Issued
content: Areas including Vijay Chowk, Connaught Place, Minto Bridge, Sarojini Nagar, AIIMS, and Panchkuian Marg witnessed intense showers.

title: Telangana Minister Konda Surekha To Face Criminal Charges In Ex-Minister KTR Defamation Case
content: The Nampally Court, after reviewing preliminary evidence, determined there was sufficient prima facie material to proceed with the case.

title: "Has His Reasons": Shashi Tharoor On Rahul Gandhi's "Dead Economy" Remark
content: Shashi Tharoor's remarks came after his party colleague Rahul Gandhi agreed with Donald Trump's statement that the Indian economy is "dead".

title: Ancient Hindu Idols Found During Excavation At A Spring In Jammu And Kashmir
content: Ancient Hindu idols, including 'Shivlings', were recovered during excavation work for the renovation of a spring in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district.

title: Delhi Police Ban Sub-Conventional Aerial Platforms Ahead Of Independence Day
content: Delhi Police Commissioner SBK Singh on Saturday ordered a ban on sub-conventional aerial platforms across the national capital from August 2 to August 16 in view of security preparations related to the upcoming Independence Day.

title: Bhupesh Baghel, Son Move Supreme Court Over CBI, Probe Agency Role In Liquor Case
content: Bhupesh Baghel and his son Chaitanya Baghel have approached the Supreme Court, seeking the legal authority and jurisdiction of central investigative agencies in probing alleged irregularities linked to the multi-crore liquor scam in the state.

title: Major Improvement In Water Quality Of Yamuna River In July: Minister
content: Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Saturday said the Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) has reported a significant improvement in the water quality of the Yamuna river in July.

title: Loan fraud case: ED proof confirms use of fake docs; BTPL MD, Anil Ambani may be quizzed together
content: Enforcement Directorate arrested Partha Biswal, MD of Biswal Tradelink Pvt Ltd, concerning a Rs 68-crore fake bank guarantee provided by Reliance ADAG to SECI. Reliance Power Ltd allegedly paid Rs 5.4 crore to Biswal's company for the fraudulent guarantee, using forged documents. Anil Ambani has been summoned for questioning, and a lookout circular has been issued against him.

title: 'He has his reasons': Tharoor sidesteps Rahul Gandhi's 'dead economy' remark; raises trade concerns
content: Shashi Tharoor declined to comment on Rahul Gandhi's agreement with Donald Trump's assessment of the Indian economy. Tharoor emphasized the importance of maintaining strong economic ties with the US, highlighting India's significant exports. He urged support for negotiators to secure a fair deal for India and advocated for exploring alternative export regions.

title: Prajwal Revanna case: SIT chief says ‚Äòsurvivor stood like a rock‚Äô
content: SIT chief BK Singh commended the rape survivor's resilience in the Prajwal Revanna case, highlighting her crucial testimony despite the four-year gap since the offences. The investigation involved extensive evidence and witnesses, with officials affirming no external interference. The swift judicial process led to Prajwal's conviction on all counts within just over a year.

title: Mid-air assault: Man slapped during ‚Äòpanic attack‚Äô on IndiGo flight found
content: IndiGo has banned a passenger from its flights for 30 days after he assaulted a co-passenger on a Mumbai-Kolkata flight. The incident, which involved Hafijul Rahaman slapping Hossain Ahmed Majumder, occurred after Majumder experienced a panic attack. Police are investigating, and other airlines may also impose no-fly restrictions. Majumder is currently traveling back home to Cachar by train.

title: IPL | CSK have a few holes to plug in mini auction: MS Dhoni
content: Chennai Super Kings, after a disappointing IPL 2025 season, found some late optimism with injury replacements. MS Dhoni believes the batting order is now sorted for the next edition with Ruturaj Gaikwad's return.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-yr-old AI researcher who rejected Meta's $125m job offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.

title: Watch: Hilarious! Jadeja asks England spectator to change t-shirt during IND vs ENG 5th Test
content: During the fifth Test at The Oval, Ravindra Jadeja playfully requested a spectator to change his red t-shirt, which was interfering with his sightline. The fan obliged, earning cheers and a thumbs-up from Jadeja. Meanwhile, India dominated Day 3, propelled by Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and crucial lower-order runs, setting England a challenging target.

title: J&K: Op Akhal enters Day 3; at least one terrorist killed during encounter
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district, security forces initiated Operation Akhal, resulting in the neutralization of one terrorist. The operation, a joint effort by the Army, J&K Police, and Special Operations Group, targeted the Akhal Khulsan forest area following intelligence inputs. Ongoing operations aim to dismantle the broader ecosystem of terrorism, including targeting drug smuggling and overground workers.

title: IND vs ENG 5th Test: Sunil Gavaskar surprises Shubman Gill ‚Äì Watch
content: Shubman Gill received a special shirt and cap from Sunil Gavaskar after falling short of breaking Gavaskar's Test series record. Gill scored 754 runs in the series, just 20 shy of the record. Gavaskar presented the gifts to encourage Gill to aim for the record in future series.

title: OpenAI executive to students: 'Studying computer science is‚Ä¶'
content: OpenAI chairman Bret Taylor asserts that computer science degrees remain invaluable, fostering 'systems thinking' crucial for product development, a skill AI can't replicate. Bill Gates echoes this, stating AI tools enhance programming but won't replace human ingenuity in spotting patterns and making critical decisions. Programming will remain a human job for at least a century.

title: Ancient Hindu idols unearthed in J&K's Anantnag district
content: During a spring restoration in Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir, ancient Hindu idols and Shivlings were discovered, potentially linked to the Karkoota dynasty. The artefacts, found at the Karkoot Nag spring, are now under the care of the Department of Archives, Archaeology and Museums for study.

title: Happy friendship day 2025: 40+wishes, images, messages, quotes, pictures and greeting cards
content: Friendship Day, celebrated on the first Sunday of August, is a special occasion to appreciate the cherished bonds we share with our friends. It's a time to express gratitude, reconnect, and acknowledge their importance in our lives.

title: IND vs ENG | New pace trio‚Äôs bold mantra: ‚ÄòWatch out for each other‚Äô
content: Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna, IPL teammates, showcased their Test bowling prowess, partnering with Akash Deep to revitalize India's attack in the final Test against England. Their strategic discussions during a crucial lunch break at Oval proved pivotal.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: ‚ÄòI think we have to accomplish more‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai and executives like Brian Saluzzo are urging employees to accelerate the integration of AI into their workflows, aiming for increased productivity and efficiency. This push includes internal AI tools like Cider and training programs developed with DeepMind, such as "Building with Gemini," to enhance software engineers' capabilities.

title: IND vs ENG: Hopes rise at the Oval! Jaiswal's ton headlines spirited batting show
content: Akash Deep's aggressive half-century and Yashasvi Jaiswal's composed century powered India to a commanding position on Day 3 at the Oval. Aided by enterprising lower-order contributions, India set England a target of 374. Mohammed Siraj's late wicket has given India an advantage heading into the final day, raising hopes of leveling the series.

title: ‚ÄúHe wants her to feel safe‚Äù: Travis Kelce prioritizes Taylor Swift‚Äôs privacy; shieldsherfromdrama
content: Travis Kelce recently shared rare photos with Taylor Swift on social media, a move reportedly discussed with the pop star beforehand. Sources reveal Kelce prioritized Swift's comfort and privacy, ensuring she approved of the images before posting. While Kelce gears up for the NFL season and Swift remains out of the public eye, their relationship nears the two-year mark.

title: Watch: Unbelievable! 41-yo ABD battles hamstring injury to score 47-ball ton vs PAK
content: AB de Villiers, at 41 and battling a hamstring injury, delivered a stunning unbeaten 120 off 60 balls, leading South Africa Champions to a dominant 9-wicket victory over Pakistan Champions in the WCL 2025 final. His explosive innings, supported by JP Duminy's quickfire 50*, secured the win and earned him Player of the Match and Tournament honours.

title: 'Died shortly after dinner': Anti-Khalistan US activist dies mysteriously in California
content: Sukhi Chahal, a US-based businessman and vocal critic of Khalistani separatism, has died in California under what his friends describe as suspicious circumstances. Chahal, who received death threats for his views, reportedly fell ill suddenly after a dinner invitation.

title: Veteran actor-comedian Madhan Bob passes away at 71 in Chennai - Deets inside
content: Tamil cinema mourns the loss of veteran actor and comedian Madhan Bob, who passed away at 71 in Chennai due to cancer. Known for his impeccable comic timing and memorable roles in numerous films alongside stars like Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan, he also gained fame as a judge on the comedy show 'Asathapovadhu Yaaru'.

title: India‚Äôs US crude oil imports surge over 50% in first half of 2025: Report
content: India significantly increased crude oil imports from the US in early 2025, with a surge in the April-June quarter. This growth extends to LNG and LPG, supported by strong diplomatic ties. However, this trade relationship faces challenges as President Trump announced tariffs on India, citing trade imbalances and ties with Russia.

title: WWE SummerSlam 2025: Night 1 Quick Highlights: List of all winners, top performers, and more
content: Night 1 of WWE SummerSlam 2025 in New Jersey saw Reigns and Uso triumph over Breakker and Reed, while Flair and Bliss captured the Women's Tag Team titles. Zayn defeated Kross, and Stratton retained her Women's Championship. In a shocking turn, Rollins cashed in his Money in the Bank briefcase after Punk's victory over GUNTHER, stealing the World Heavyweight Championship.

title: Watch: Crawley tries to force another 'grow some f***ing balls' moment; Gill reacts
content: Tension gripped The Oval as India and England battled in the final Test. Zak Crawley's attempts to disrupt Mohammed Siraj backfired when Siraj bowled him with a stunning yorker just before stumps. Earlier, Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and valuable contributions from Akash Deep, Jadeja, and Sundar propelled India to 396, setting England a target of 374.

title: Struck in ‚ÄòRudra roop‚Äô: PM dedicates Op Sindoor success to Shiva; warns Pak with UP-made missiles
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his Varanasi visit, dedicated Operation Sindoor's success to Lord Vishwanath, highlighting India's firm stance against terrorism. He criticized opposition parties for questioning the operation's timing and mourning the destruction of terrorist bases in Pakistan. Modi emphasized India's growing defense capabilities, noting that missiles made in Uttar Pradesh will deter future Pakistani misadventures.

title: IND vs ENG: R Ashwin says India may have unearthed a gem ‚Äì ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs got that raw...'
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has lauded Akash Deep's batting prowess during the ongoing Test match, highlighting his fearless approach and natural talent. Akash Deep showcased his skills by smashing a maiden half-century, forming a crucial partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal. Ashwin noted Akash Deep's solid defense, clean hitting ability, and effectiveness on the off-side, suggesting India may have found a promising batting prospect.

title: As SA crush PAK for WCL 2025, Raina: 'Would‚Äôve crushed too but chose nation above ...'
content: South Africa Champions clinched the WCL 2025 title, defeating Pakistan Champions by 9 wickets in a dominant final performance highlighted by AB de Villiers' explosive 120*. However, India Champions' controversial withdrawal from the semi-final against Pakistan, due to undisclosed reasons, sparked debate. Suresh Raina asserted that India would have won, emphasizing national priorities over the game.

title: ‚ÄòDhadak 2‚Äô BO day 2: Siddhant Chaturvedi, Triptii Dimri starrer sees a slight improvement
content: ‚ÄòDhadak 2,‚Äô starring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri, faced competition from ‚ÄòSon Of Sardaar 2‚Äô and ‚ÄòSaiyaara‚Äô upon its release on August 1, 2025. The film, a remake exploring casteism, earned Rs. 3.5 crore on Friday and Rs. 3.75 crore on Saturday, totaling Rs. 7.25 crore.

title: Hailee Steinfeld's latest workout photos break the internet
content: While Josh Allen focuses on football, Hailee Steinfeld prioritizes her well-being through fitness and mindfulness. She emphasizes the importance of workouts for mental clarity and emotional resilience, supported by her father, Pete Steinfeld, a personal trainer. Hailee embraces balance, letting go of past body image struggles and finding joy in her wellness journey, setting an example of inner strength.

title: Ayesha Curry‚Äôs ‚Äòannoyed‚Äô look as Steph signs kid‚Äôs jersey goes viral
content: A video of Stephen Curry signing a young fan's jersey during a golf outing went viral, but it was Ayesha Curry's reaction that truly captured the internet's attention. While Steph graciously interacted with the fan, Ayesha's seemingly unimpressed demeanor sparked debate, with some criticizing her while others defended her desire for privacy amidst constant public attention.

title: Gabrielle Union on menopause: 'It makes it hard' ‚Äî motherhood now more emotional, exhausting
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: Video reunites ex-cop with family: Salute in Bhopal old-age home goes viral; long-lost son found
content: In Bhopal, a chance encounter at an old-age home led to an incredible reunion after 42 years. DSP Santosh Patel, while visiting the home, was saluted by an elderly resident, Puran Singh, a former policeman. Patel shared the video, which went viral, reconnecting Singh with his long-lost son after decades of separation due to mental health struggles and displacement.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office day 16: Film marches towards the Rs 300 crore club
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara,' directed by Mohit Suri, has become a box office success, surprising many with its strong performance. The romantic musical, released on July 18, has earned ‚Çπ291.35 crore in 16 days.

title: 'Dead man talking to girlfriend?' HC slams MP Police for shoddy probe
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court overturned a life sentence for a father and son convicted of murdering a man involved with their daughter/sister, citing severe flaws in the police investigation. The court highlighted manipulated evidence, including impossible phone records and a dubious eyewitness, prompting a directive for inquiry against the investigating officer.

title: Punjab farmer jailed in Pak for border crossing: Gets one-month term; fined Rs 1 lakh
content: Amritpal Singh, a 23-year-old Punjab farmer, has been sentenced by a Pakistani court in Chunian after inadvertently crossing into Pakistan. He received a one-month prison term for each of two offenses and a fine of Rs 50,000 for each. Failure to pay the fines will result in an additional 15 days of imprisonment per offense.

title: VP polls: 4 of total 16 elections held for vice-president posts won uncontested
content: Out of the 16 Vice-Presidential elections held in India, four were uncontested, with S Radhakrishnan winning twice unopposed. Several Vice-Presidents, including V V Giri and Shankar Dayal Sharma, resigned to become President. The Election Commission has compiled a booklet detailing the election process and past results, highlighting instances of invalid votes despite a small electoral college.

title: Dhankhar forced out by govt as he decided to go by book: Kharge
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge claimed Jagdeep Dhankhar was forced to resign as Vice-President after he started acting independently and allowed a notice for the removal of Justice Varma. Kharge alleged that Dhankhar faced threats and pressure from the Modi government for upholding constitutional norms, leading to his ousting. Sonia Gandhi accused the BJP-RSS of dismantling the Constitution.

content: Washington Commanders owner Josh Harris addressed reporters after striking one of the biggest deals in recent franchise history . Harris wore the expression of an athlete who had just won a big game . he grew up a fan of the team he bought from previous owner Dan Snyder for $6.05 billion in 2023 .

content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . former Rays starter Blake Snell has not toed a major league rubber since early April . the veteran lefty has been sidelined with left shoulder inflammation .

title: 2K Games details gameplay changes for NBA 2K26
content: the ProPLAY Motion Engine has overhauled how players move on the court . the engine will reduce the phenomenon of players "skating" over the floor . this also includes a new collision system that aims to be more reliable than motion capture animations used previously .

content: Bharti Jain is senior editor at the Times of India, new Delhi . she has been writing on security matters since 1996 . her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife .

title: US escalates war on marriage fraud in green card applications, updates its policy manual
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022 . 68 trades on deadline day went down with a flurry of activity . the Astros traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: Malegaon blast: How missing key docs, mishandled evidence crippled the case
content: Armed with a degree in political science and law, Rebecca Samervel waltzed into journalism after a brief stint in modeling. As a reporter at The Times of India, Mumbai, she covers courts. She is a self-confessed food-a-holic. Travelling, politics and television are her passions. If you want to find her during the week the only place to look is the Bombay high court. title: ‚öæ Making sense of the MLB trade deadline
content: the 2025 trade deadline is in the books . the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros made surprising moves that rocked the deadline . ESPN experts debate what's real moving forward . there's no team to beat in the American League, Bradford Doolittle says .

title: WWE SummerSlam Night 1 results: Seth Rollins cashes in on CM Punk, becomes new champion
content: CM Punk defeated Gunther to become the new WWE world heavyweight champion . he had won a gauntlet match last month on "Raw" to earn the right to challenge him . former members of the Bloodline, cousins Roman Reigns and Jey Uso team up .

title: How did the Cowboys and Parsons get here? Plus league reaction and what‚Äôs next
content: quarterback dak Prescott and receiver ceeDee Lamb didn't get their respective new deals done until close to the season . on friday, parsons posted on social media that he is requesting a trade . "i no longer want to play for the Dallas Cowboys," he wrote .

title: A new district flood severity index factors in flood impact on people
content: Researchers from IIT Delhi and IIT Gandhinagar have come up with a District Flood Severity Index (DFSI) that takes into account the mean duration in days of all flooding events in a district, percentage of area that is historically flooded, total number of deaths, number of people injured, and the population in the district

title: Woman‚Äôs mutilated body found in U.P.'s Bijnor
content: The police suspect the woman was attacked by a leopard, forest officials believe it to be a case of murder, with the body later mauled by an animal

title: Ancient Hindu idols recovered during excavation at a spring in J&K's Anantnag district
content: The Public Works Department is undertaking revival and restoration works in the spring and the labourers recovered the idols during the excavation work

title: 78 students in Chhattisgarh given anti-rabies injections after dog contaminates mid-day meal; probe on
content: The students narrated the incident to their families, after which parents and villagers approached the school, including its management committee chairperson Jhalendra Sahu, for clarification

title: Tirunelveli killing: When caste pride slays young love
content: The recent killing of C.¬†Kavin¬†Selvaganesh, a Scheduled Caste youth, just because he was in love with a girl of an intermediate caste, has again spotlighted rampant caste pride in southern Tamil Nadu.¬†P.¬†Sudhakar¬†and¬†C.¬†Palanivel¬†Rajan¬†examine the specific circumstances leading to the murder and also highlight the caste hegemony in the region

title: Hitec City road buckles under tech traffic boom, clogs with 1.5 lakh vehicles per day
content: The road caters to approximately five lakh IT employees per day with 7,000 vehicles per hour in a single direction during peak hours

title: Infant dies after falling into stagnant water at their waterlogged house in Kolkata‚Äôs Dum Dum area
content: This development comes as¬†State residents complain about bad road conditions and incessant waterlogging issues on pivotal areas

title: West Bengal government and Centre are not keen for resumption of MGNREGA, despite Calcuttal HC order
content: Neither of the governments is willing to resume the scheme when West Bengal is facing a huge migrant crisis, with millions leaving the State in search of work

title: Focus is on promoting event management sector to boost tourism, says A.P. Minister
content: Tourism Policy aims at increasing the sector‚Äôs contribution to the State‚Äôs GDP from 4.6% to 8% and creating 2 lakh new jobs, says Kandula Durgesh

title: Prajwal Revanna rape case: We will register more cases if survivors come forward even now, says SIT Chief B.K. Singh¬†
content: The victim in the case was from the lowest strata of society, socially and economically, while the accused was from the most powerful political family of the State, said Mr. Singh

title: India‚Äôs logistics cost will be down to less than 10% by December: Gadkari¬†
content: The Union Minister virtually lays foundation for 27 road projects and inaugurates two others costing about ‚Çπ5,235 crore in Andhra Pradesh

title: Bird deaths raise red flags as India expands wind energy
content: Across seven multi-season surveys, Wildlife Institute of India researchers searched for bird carcasses within a 150-m radius of 90 randomly selected wind turbines and found 124

title: Gulmarg‚Äôs famous 137-year-old Nedous hotel served eviction notice
content: The family had earned multiple leases from the government till 1985, but failed to renew the same after its expiration in 1985. The J&K government rejected the lease in February 2015.

title: Simpler tests could slash biosimilar costs, widen patient access

content: The Prime Minister's remarks came just days after U.S. President Donald Trump called India a "dead economy"

title: Why is northeast on edge about Assam evictions? | Explained
content: What is the reason for an aggressive eviction drive from forestlands? What has been the reaction in neighbouring States? Why does Assam have boundary disputes with Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, Mizoram, and Nagaland? What has the Gauhati High Court directed the States to do?

content: What are the sectors that will need to rework their export strategies? Why are India‚Äôs dealings with Russia under scrutiny? Will the 25% tariff and penalty affect GDP? Why hasn‚Äôt a trade deal worked out between the two countries? What are the main areas of contention?

title: Waterborne freight transport resumes in Assam after 10 years
content: The Kopili River, designated National Waterway 57, was operationalised on August 2 with the first-ever cargo trial run

title: Bail for nuns a relief, but fight for justice will continue, says Raphael Thattil
content: Raphael Thattil said that the bail has lifted a heavy burden, though ‚Äúit does not mark the end of our quest for justice‚Äù

title: India will continue to buy Russian oil, government sources tell NYT

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar: A man of many persuasions
content: In his political career spanning four decades, the former Vice President had worked in three political parties of different ideologies ‚Äî the Janata Dal, the Congress and finally the BJP

title: 'He's pretty much a rookie': The good and bad of J.J. McCarthy at Vikings camp

title: What you missed from recruiting this summer
content: the busiest 60 days of the annual recruiting calendar are officially behind us . 155 prospects in the 2026 ESPN 300 made commitments in an avalanche of summer recruiting business from June 1 to July 31 . only 16 uncommitteds remain in the ESPN 300 as of Saturday morning .
